current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To save coal jobs, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read the first time

action-desc.#text: Read the second time and placed on the calendar
Read the second time and placed on the calendar

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 201. National pollutant discharge elimination system.
Sec. 202. Permits for dredged or fill material.
Sec. 203. Impacts of Environmental Protection Agency regulatory activity on employment and economic activity.
Sec. 204. Identification of waters protected by the Clean Water Act.
Sec. 205. Limitations on authority to modify State water quality standards.
Sec. 206. State authority to identify waters within boundaries of the State.

the issuance of

any action to
		control emissions of greenhouse gases from existing coal fired power plants in
		the United States by mandating a national energy tax would devastate major
		sectors of the economy, cost thousands of jobs, and increase energy costs for
		low-income households, small businesses, and seniors on fixed income;

quote.#text:
The unemployment rate is well established as a risk factor for elevated
			 illness and mortality rates in epidemiological studies performed since the
			 early 1980s. In addition to influences on mental disorder, suicide and alcohol
			 abuse and alcoholism, unemployment is also an important risk factor in
			 cardiovascular disease and overall decreases in life
			 expectancy.

children in poor families were

text.#text:
any major
			 decision that would cost the economy of the United States millions of dollars
			 and lead to serious negative health effects for the people of the United States
			 should be debated and explicitly authorized by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should make United States energy as clean as practicable,
			 as quickly as practicable, without increasing the cost of energy for struggling
			 families, seniors, low-income households, and small businesses.

text.#text:
any policy
			 adopted by

The
		purposes of this section are—

to ensure
		that—

to allow
		sufficient time for Congress to develop and authorize an appropriate mechanism
		to address the energy needs of the United States and the potential challenges
		posed by severe weather; and

to restore the
		legislative process and congressional authority over the energy policy of the
		United States.

Notwithstanding
		any other provision of law, the head of a Federal agency shall not promulgate
		any regulation relating to power sector carbon pollution standards or any
		substantially similar regulation on or after June 25, 2013, unless that
		regulation is explicitly authorized by an Act of Congress.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 404(g)(1) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act

header.#text:
Impacts of Environmental Protection Agency
			 regulatory activity on employment and economic activity

text.#text:
In
			 this section:

term.#tail:
means
			 the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means any of the
			 following actions taken by the

text.#text: The term

Issuing a regulation, policy statement,
			 guidance, response to a petition, or other requirement.

Implementing a new or substantially altered
			 program.

header.#text:
More than a de
			 minimis negative impact

term.#text:
more than a de minimis
			 negative impact

text.#text: The term

With respect to
			 employment levels, a loss of more than 100 jobs, except that any offsetting job gains that
			 result from the hypothetical creation of new jobs through new technologies or
			 government employment may not be used in the job loss calculation.

With respect to
			 economic activity, a decrease in economic activity of more than $1,000,000 over
			 any calendar year, except that any offsetting economic activity that results from the
			 hypothetical creation of new economic activity through new technologies or
			 government employment may not be used in the economic activity
			 calculation.

header.#text:
Analysis of
			 impacts of actions on employment and economic activity
